docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 22 The House Appropriations Committee, largely at the prodding of a middle-of-the-road Missouri Congressman, has voted to place restrictions on a secret contingency fund that the Central Intelligence Agency has, in the past, used to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 22 The House Appropriations Committee, largely at the prodding of a middle-of-the-road Missouri Congressman, has voted to place restrictions on a secret contingency fund that the Central Intelligence Agency has, in the past, used to initiate covert operations without the prior knowledge of Congress.
docs.abstract: HR Appropriations Com votes to limit amt of CIA's secret contingency fund, money used to pay for covert operations without prior Cong knowledge; action is compromise move following rejection of Repr Bill D Burlison's measure to eliminate fund entirely; fund reptdly ranges from $50- to $100-million; agency's total budget is about $6.2-billion (M)

headline.main: Panel Backs Curb On C.I.A. Buildup Of a Secret Fund; Goal Is to Strengthen Congressional Role PANEL BACKS CURB ON C.I.A. BUILDUP

byline.original: By ANTHONY MARRO Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Georgie Best and the Los Angeles Aztecs, the team with the best record in the North American Soccer League, will be at Giants Stadium this afternoon to play the Cosmos, whose fivegame winning streak was ended in St.

headline.main: There's a Long Way to Go, but General Videla Opposes an Elitist Regime; Argentina's Leadership Leans Toward Democracy

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 28 The State Department said today that two loans to aid Chile's poor farmers had been blocked at least temporarily because of the human-rights situation in that country the first time economic assistance for humanitarian purposes is...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 28 The State Department said today that two loans to aid Chile's poor farmers had been blocked at least temporarily because of the human-rights situation in that country the first time economic assistance for humanitarian purposes is known to have been held up for such reasons.
docs.abstract: US State Dept says nearly $10-million in loans to aid Chile's poor farmers have been blocked temporarily because of human-rights situation in Chile, 1st time such assistance has been held up for such reasons; dept spokesman Hodding Carter 3d says dept decided to defer action to see what changes might develop in human rights situation; differences between US officials over question of loans discussed (M)

headline.main: U.S. Defers Two Loans to Chile, Citing Human-Rights Situation

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 28 The State Department said today that two loans to aid Chile's poor farmers had been blocked at least temporarily because of the human-rights situation in that country the first time economic assistance for humanitarian purposes is...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 28 The State Department said today that two loans to aid Chile's poor farmers had been blocked at least temporarily because of the human-rights situation in that country the first time economic assistance for humanitarian purposes is known to have been held up for such reasons.
docs.abstract: US defers almost $10-million in loans to aid nation's farmers, citing Govt's violations of human rights (M)

headline.main: U.S. Defers Two Loans to Chile, Citing Human-Rights Situation

docs.snippet: In their fifth appearance on national television, yesterday and their fifth without a victory the Cosmos proved again that well-known names don't win games in the North American Soccer League.
docs.lead_paragraph: In their fifth appearance on national television, yesterday and their fifth without a victory the Cosmos proved again that well-known names don't win games in the North American Soccer League.

headline.main: Firmani Debut a Loss for Cosmos

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 15--A key Senate subcommittee gave strong support to the Carter Administration today and struck from a pending foreign aid bill provisions that would have barred the World Bank from using American funds in loans to Vietnam and six...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 15--A key Senate subcommittee gave strong support to the Carter Administration today and struck from a pending foreign aid bill provisions that would have barred the World Bank from using American funds in loans to Vietnam and six other countries.
docs.abstract: Sen Appropriations subcom on foreign assistance deletes from HR-approved foreign aid bill provision forbidding mil assistance to Brazil (S)

headline.main: Senate Panel Backs Carter, Eliminates Restrictions on Aid; Aid Cut Eliminated
